data.text: @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS That's great  COVID-19  more  Vaccination  center clinic spread it out.  That way more people will take Vaccine.  At the beginning Vaccine was shortage  & clinic wasn't near . When School Kid's Vaccine will be available  -its better to have  clinic at school.  Thank you. https://t.co/UkXmWQtjfQ

@NormCash25 @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS Your point that the CDC/FDA is doing a piss poor job of investigating and reporting the numbers is noted.  What other government reporting should we not trust? They classify the follow up data. I have clearances and I can’t access it

@optigrabsales @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS It’s more than just lack of verification. “The number of reports alone cannot be interpreted or used to reach conclusions about the existence, severity, frequency, or rates of problems associated with vaccines.” I just don’t know how much clearer they can be about this.
@optigrabsales @NormCash25 @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS No no, these are *diagnoses* being monitored for. These aren’t things that vaccine recipients can watch for (e.g Alveolar proteinosis).
@NormCash25 @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS You should also note that follow up data is kept confidential.

@NormCash25 @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS So yeah you are right that all the reports have not been verified primarily because the government has failed to follow up.  That’s a sorry excuse disclaiming data.  Nor does it say the data is false, just that they have been negligent in follow up.

@NormCash25 @JudgeClayJ @DallasParkRec @DCHHS I’m posting data provided by the government.  It has been well established that these numbers vastly under represent the true numbers of adverse events.  You are relying on a disclaimer that all reports aren’t verified. They are behind by 8 months verifying.
